edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation

Class ScRSAPermutation

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation.TrapdoorPermutationAbs
      • edu.biu.scapi.primitives.trapdoorPermutation.ScRSAPermutation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RSAPermutation, TrapdoorPermutation

    public final class ScRSAPermutation
extends TrapdoorPermutationAbs
implements RSAPermutation
    Concrete class of trapdoor permutation for RSA.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Initializes this RSA permutation with public key. After this initialization, this object can do compute but not invert. This initialization is for user that wants to encrypt a message using the public key but deosn't want to decrypt a message.
        Specified by:
        setKey in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Overrides:
        setKey in class TrapdoorPermutationAbs
        Parameters:
        publicKey - - public key
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key is not a RSA key

      • isElement

        public TPElValidity isElement(TPElement tpEl)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks if the given element is valid to RSA permutation
        Specified by:
        isElement in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Parameters:
        tpEl - - the element to check
        Returns:
        TPElValidity - enum number that indicate the validation of the element There are three possible validity values: VALID (it is an element) NOT_VALID (it is not an element) DONT_KNOW (there is not enough information to check if it is an element or not)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given element is not a RSA element

      • generateTPElement

        public TPElement generateTPElement(java.math.BigInteger x)
                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates an RSA Element from a specific value x. It checks that the x value is valid for this trapdoor permutation.
        Specified by:
        generateTPElement in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Returns:
        TPElement - If the x value is valid for this permutation return the created random element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given value x is invalid for this permutation
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the keys aren't set

      • generateUncheckedTPElement

        public TPElement generateUncheckedTPElement(java.math.BigInteger x)
                                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates an RSA Element from a specific value x. It checks that the x value is valid for this trapdoor permutation.
        Specified by:
        generateUncheckedTPElement in interface TrapdoorPermutation
        Returns:
        TPElement - If the x value is valid for this permutation return the created random element
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given value x is invalid for this permutation
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the keys aren't set

      • generateRSAModulus

        public static RSAModulus generateRSAModulus(int length,
                                            int certainty,
                                            java.security.SecureRandom random)
        This function generates an RSA modulus N with "length" bits of length, such that N = p*q, and p and q
        Parameters:
        length - the length in bits of the RSA modulus
        certainty - the certainty required regarding the primeness of p and q
        random - a source of randomness
        Returns:
        an RSAModulus structure that holds N, p and q.
